alert.note: Alert for Kit Carson County; Yuma County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 20 at 6:37PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Yuma and northeastern Kit Carson Counties through 715 PM MDT... At 637 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles southeast of Cope, or 20 miles north of Stratton, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Yuma and northeastern Kit Carson Counties, including the following locations... Kirk, Joes and Idalia. This includes Highway 385 between mile markers 204 and 210, and between mile markers 212 and 216. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for northeastern and east central Colorado.
